frame.name: Intoxicants
frame.definition: <def-root>An <fen>Intoxicant</fen> is ingested in order to achieve an altered state of consciousness. A <fen>Type</fen> or <fen>Descriptor</fen> may be indicated as well. <ex> We <gov>smoked</gov> <x>some <fex name="Descriptor">high-grade</fex> <fex name="Intoxicant"><t>marijuana</t></fex></x>.</ex> <ex>They <gov>smoked</gov> <x><fex name="Type">freebase</fex> <fex name="Intoxicant"><t>cocaine</t></fex></x>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Intoxicant
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Intoxicant</fen> is ingested. <ex> We <gov>smoke</gov> <x> <fex name = "Intoxicant"><t>marijuana</t></fex></x> every day.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Type</fen> identifies the kind or sort of <fen>Intoxicant</fen>. <ex>They smoked <fex name="Type">freebase</fex> <fex name="Intoxicant">cocaine</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Descriptor</fen> describes a quality of the <fen>Intoxicant</fen>. <ex> We smoked some <fex name="Descriptor">fine</fex> <fex name = "Intoxicant">marijuana</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Country_of_origin
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Country_of_origin</fen> identifies where the <fen>Intoxicant</fen> is grown or originates.
<ex> The British enjoy <fex name="Country_of_origin">Afghanistan's</fex> <fex name="Intoxicant">opium</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: marijuana.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: cannabis, especially as smoked in cigarettes.

lexUnit.name: heroin.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a highly addictive analgesic drug derived from morphine, often used illicitly as a narcotic

lexUnit.name: cocaine.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a highly addictive stimulant drug derived from the coca plant, often used illicitly as a narcotic and rarely prescribed as a topical anaesthetic in dentistry

lexUnit.name: opium.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an addictive drug prepared from the juice of a poppy (Papaver somniferum), used illicitly as a narcotic and occasionally in medicine as an analgesic

lexUnit.name: LSD.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a synthetic crystalline compound, lysergic acid diethylamide, which is a powerful hallucinogenic drug.

lexUnit.name: mescaline.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a hallucinogenic compound present in the peyote cactus.

lexUnit.name: ecstasy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an illegal amphetamine-based synthetic drug with euphoric effects

lexUnit.name: methamphetamine.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a synthetic drug with more rapid and lasting effects than amphetamine, used illegally as a stimulant.

lexUnit.name: cannabis.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a dried preparation or resinous extract made from a plant, used (generally illegally) as a psychotropic drug (chiefly in cigarettes)

lexUnit.name: amphetamine.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a synthetic mood-altering drug, used illegally as a stimulant

lexUnit.name: barbiturate.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: any of a class of sedative drugs derived from barbituric acid.

lexUnit.name: sedative.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a drug that promotes calm

lexUnit.name: tranquillizer.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a drug with a sedative effect

lexUnit.name: dope.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an illegal drug, especially cannabis or (US) heroin

lexUnit.name: coke.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: informal term for cocaine.

lexUnit.name: upper.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a stimulating drug, especially amphetamine.

lexUnit.name: downer.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a depressant or tranquillizing drug

lexUnit.name: speed.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an amphetamine drug, especially methamphetamine.

lexUnit.name: crack.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a potent hard crystalline form of cocaine broken into small pieces.

lexUnit.name: freebase.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: cocaine that has been purified by heating with ether, taken by inhaling the fumes or smoking the residue.

lexUnit.name: pot.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: cannabis.

lexUnit.name: acid.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the drug LSD

lexUnit.name: hallucinogen.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a drug causing hallucinations

lexUnit.name: tobacco.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a preparation of the dried and fermented nicotine-rich leaves of an American plant, used for smoking or chewing

lexUnit.name: nicotine.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a toxic oily liquid which is the chief active constituent of tobacco.

lexUnit.name: alcohol.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a colourless volatile flammable liquid which is the intoxicating constituent of wine, beer, spirits, etc.

lexUnit.name: ketamine.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a synthetic compound used as an anaesthetic and analgesic drug and also illicitly as a hallucinogen.

lexUnit.name: morphine.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an analgesic and narcotic drug obtained from opium and used medicinally to relieve pain.

lexUnit.name: codeine.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sleep-inducing and analgesic drug derived from morphine.

lexUnit.name: inhalant.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a solvent or other material producing vapour that is inhaled by drug abusers

lexUnit.name: weed.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: cannabis.

lexUnit.name: grass.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: cannabis.

lexUnit.name: hashish.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: cannabis

lexUnit.name: peyote.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a hallucinogenic drug prepared from a small, soft, blue-green spineless cactus, native to Mexico and the southern US, containing mescaline

lexUnit.name: snuff.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: powdered tobacco that is sniffed up the nostril.

lexUnit.name: drug.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a chemical that affects the nervous system causing changes in perception and/or behavior.

lexUnit.name: cigarette.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: Paper-rolled tobacco containers often including a variety of chemicals including nicotine.
